entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin sacrificium, from sacr-, sacer + facere to make do

def.dt: :an act of offering to a deity something precious
:the killing of a victim on an altar
:destruction or surrender of something for the sake of something else
:something given up or lost the sacrifices made by parents
:to suffer loss of, give up, renounce, injure, or destroy especially for an ideal, belief, or end
:to advance (a base runner) by means of a sacrifice hit
:to kill (an animal) as part of a scientific experiment
:to make or perform the rites of a sacrifice
:to make a sacrifice hit in baseball
:an outfield fly in baseball caught by a fielder after which a runner scores
:a bunt in baseball that allows a runner to advance one base while the batter is put out
:sacrifice of oneself or one's interest for others or for a cause or ideal
